  "description": "Avetium Consult Limited - We are a Top Outsourcing Company in Nigeria, offering top-tier Business Technology Solutions and BPO services to drive measurable success for organizations.

Job Position: BPO Sales Manager

Employment Type: Full-time

Overall Purpse of Job


	The BPO Sales Manager will be responsible for leading and supervising a team of field sales representatives to drive product sales, market penetration and customer acquisition.
	The role focuses on planning, implementing and monitoring field sales strategies to achieve business targets while ensuring excellent customer engagement and brand visibility in the assigned territory.


Responsibilities


	Recruit, train, supervise, and motivate field sales agents to achieve individual and team sales targets.
	Develop and execute field sales strategies and action plans to expand market reach and meet business goals.
	Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly performance reviews to track agent productivity and ensure target achievement.
	Identify new business opportunities, key markets, and potential customers within assigned territories.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to provide feedback for business improvement.
	Ensure accurate and timely reporting of sales activities, market intelligence, and agent performance.
	Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to plan promotional activities and product activations.
	Manage customer relationships, resolve escalations, and ensure a high level of satisfaction and retention.
	Enforce compliance with company policies, sales processes, and code of conduct among field agents.
	Drive continuous performance improvement and skill development through coaching and mentoring.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, Marketing, Management, or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in field sales or direct sales management, preferably in telecommunications, ISP, or fibre broadband sales.
	Proven experience in managing field sales teams and achieving / exceeding sales targets.
	Strong understanding of fibre broadband products and customer journey processes is an advantage.
	Excellent planning, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple territories.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and sales reporting tools (CRM, Excel, etc.).
	Willingness to travel extensively and work on the field as required.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;semira.ikioda@avetiumconsult.com&nbsp;using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.",

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HSE Officer",
  "description": "Well Fluid Services Limited is an indigenous Oil and Gas Service Company established in 2001. We deliver Technical Services to the Oil and Gas Industries across Africa. We offer services in Well Clean-up/Testing, Extended Well Test/EPF, Sand Detection, Quantification, Removal &amp; Analysis, Temporary Well Hook-Up, Well Optimization, Gas Injection Rate Measurement/Well Optimization, Effluent Water Treatment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Make regular site inspections. Collate all HSE observations and maintain the register for a daily unsafe acts and unsafe conditions inspection and reports.
	Deliver HSE induction for new employees and visitors. Also, make HSE presentations to individuals or groups of employees/managers.
	Plan safe working practices and make necessary changes.
	Organise workplace inspection and track closeout of observed gaps.
	Maintain the PTW register as well as other HSE logs. Conducting PTW audits.
	Keep up to date with current health and safety legislation. Local and international, as applicable.
	Participate in incidents/accidents investigation report. Making recommendations following accidents/incidents to prevent recurrence.
	Participate in and undertake risk assessments and job hazard analysis exercises. Ensure the control measures are implemented as stated.
	Identify potential hazards and determine ways of reducing risks.
	Engage with relevant regulatory authorities and contractors on HSE matters.
	Supervise contracted and in-house jobs for safety compliance.
	Organise, attend and take minutes of meetings during health and safety meetings.
	Coordinate toolbox talks and other safety meetings and training programs.
	Lead the enforcement of HSE procedures, policies and standards to the workforce across the plant and all work sites.
	Compile HSE statistics and reports on a weekly and monthly basis.
	Keep up to date with developments within the health and safety profession.
	Act as the focal person for the management of PPE provided for Kano and keep track of issued PPE.
	Raise requisitions for HSE materials and services as well as make reservations for material issuance from the store through SAP.
	Perform and assume other duties and responsibilities as may be required by the immediate supervisor.


Qualifications


	A Bachelor&#39;s Degree in a relevant field.
	Minimum of three (3) years&#39; experience in Health and Safety.
	HSE Qualification, such as HSE Level 1-3 or NEBOSH General Certificate or equivalent.
	An advantage if the candidate is a member of the Institute of Safety Professionals of Nigeria (ISPON).
